title: What is the solution to x – x² = x² – x? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for the A2A, Harikirtan. Your original equation to solve for x: x – x² = x² – x Add x² on both sides to clear quadratic terms from one side x = x² – x + x² x = 2x² – x Subtract x on both sides to set the equation equal to zero. 0 = 2x² – x – x 0 = 2x² – 2x Factor the equation by pulling out 2x, which is GCF(2x², 2x) 2x² ÷ 2x = x2x ÷ 2x = 1The equation, 0 = 2x² – 2x, factors into: 0 = 2x (x – 1) Use the zero product rule (if A * B = 0, then either A or B = 0) by setting each factor to zero and solve for x in each factor. In this case, let 2x = 0 and let x – 1 = 0, separately.2x = 0 x = 0 ÷ 2x = 0 is a solutionx – 1 = 0 x = 0 + 1x = 1 is also a solutionThere are two possible values for x in this equation: x = 0 or x = 1 Hope it helps! ~ Aaron Chao

Q. What is the solution to x – x² = x² – x? x – x² = x² – x Re-arrange the terms, putting all terms on one side equal to 0 on the other side. ( 2x^2 —2x ) = 0Divide thru by 2 2. ( x^2 - x ) = 0 Factorise 3. x•(x - 1 ) = 0 4. Answer. x = 0, or x = 1. These values will make one bracket equal to 0, hence the equation will equal 0. Therefore the two values of x are those values that give 0 inside at leat one one of the brackets. Check. Put the values into the equation 4. x = 0 ==> (0)•(0–1) = 0. Jack Blake
